bibl.title: Greek Papyri of the Classics Department at Stanford (P. Stan. Class.). Part I.
bibl.note: The Greek Papyri from the Department of Classics at the University of Stanford (California) contain 61 numbers. The texts (all from cartonnage) date from the second half of the third and from the second century BC. The place of origin is clearly the Fayum. - 1. P. Stan. Class. Inv. 2. Contract of a loan involving a boat. Krokodilon Polis, 19 June 193 BC. - 2. Inv. 6. Receipt to the shepherds of Mouchis. Mouchis, 19 July 215 BC. - 3. Inv. 29. Receipt to the shepherds of Mouchis. Mouchis, 26 January 215 BC. - 4. Inv. 16. Receipt to shepherds. Krokodilon Polis, 203/2, 179/8, or 168/7 BC (?). - 5. Inv. 9 + 34 recto. Draft of a public sale. Krokodilon Polis, 234/3 BC. - 6. Inv. 27. Public sale. Arsinoite nome (?), 205/4, 188/7, or 164/3 BC. - 7. Inv. 24. Public sale. Arsinoite nome (?), late 3rd or early 2nd c. BC. - 8. 35 verso. Public sale. Krokodilon Polis & a village from the Herakleides meris, late 3rd or early 2nd c. BC (211/210 or 194/3 BC [?]). - 9. Inv. 54. Payment in installments. Arsinoite nome (?), 3rd c. BC. - 10. Inv. 61. Payment in installments. Arsinoite nome (?), 1st half of 2nd c. BC (?). - 11. Inv. 31. Petition from prison. Krokodilon Polis, late 3rd c. BC. - 12. Inv. 30. Note concerning a petition. Arsinoite nome (?), late 3rd c. BC. - 13. Inv. 38. Note concerning a petition. Arsinoite nome (?), late 3rd c. BC. - 14. Inv. 9 + 34 verso. Account. Krokodilon Polis (?), 234/3-211 BC. - 15. Inv. 35 recto. Account. Krokodilon Polis, late 3rd or early 2nd c. BC. - 16. Inv. 60. Account. Arsinoite nome (?), late 3rd c. BC. - 17. Inv. 48. Account (?). Arsinoite nome (?), 2nd c. BC (?). - 18. Inv. 37. Hypomnema (?). Arsinoite nome (?), February 195 or 171 BC. - 19. Inv. 43. Beginning of a contract (?). Arsinoite nome (?), late 3rd c. BC (?). - 20. Inv. 53. Draft of a letter. Arsinoite nome (?), late 3rd c. BC (221/20 or 204/3 BC [?]). - 21. Inv. 26. Letter about a gooseherd. Arsinoite nome (?), late 3rd c. BC. - 22. Inv. 45. Letter. Arsinoite nome (?), late 3rd c. BC. - 23. Inv. 46. Name list. Arsinoite nome (?), 2nd c. BC. - 24. Inv. 47. Name list. Arsinoite nome (?), 2nd c. BC. - 25. Inv. 49. Policeman. Arsinoite nome (?), late 3rd or early 2nd c. BC. - 26. Inv. 41. Act prescript. Arsinoite nome (?), late 3rd or early 2nd c. BC. - 27. Inv. 52. Personal description. Arsinoite nome (?), late 3rd c. BC (?). - 28. Inv. 44. Fragment. Arsinoite nome (?), late 3rd c. BC (?). - 29. Inv. 55. Fragment. Arsinoite nome (?), late 3rd c. BC. - 30. Inv. 57. Fragment. Arsinoite nome (?), 2nd c. BC. - 31. Inv. 58. Fragment. Arsinoite nome (?), 2nd c. BC (?). - 32. Inv. 59. Fragment. Arsinoite nome (?), 2nd c. BC.
bibl.seg: Willy Clarysse & Christelle Fischer-Bovet, Greek Papyri of the Classics Department at Stanford (P. Stan. Class.). Part I.

The Greek Papyri from the Department of Classics at the University of Stanford (California) contain 61 numbers. The texts (all from cartonnage) date from the second half of the third and from the second century BC. The place of origin is clearly the Fayum. - 1. P. Stan. Class. Inv. 2. Contract of a loan involving a boat. Krokodilon Polis, 19 June 193 BC. - 2. Inv. 6. Receipt to the shepherds of Mouchis. Mouchis, 19 July 215 BC. - 3. Inv. 29. Receipt to the shepherds of Mouchis. Mouchis, 26 January 215 BC. - 4. Inv. 16. Receipt to shepherds. Krokodilon Polis, 203/2, 179/8, or 168/7 BC (?). - 5. Inv. 9 + 34 recto. Draft of a public sale. Krokodilon Polis, 234/3 BC. - 6. Inv. 27. Public sale. Arsinoite nome (?), 205/4, 188/7, or 164/3 BC. - 7. Inv. 24. Public sale. Arsinoite nome (?), late 3rd or early 2nd c. BC. - 8. 35 verso. Public sale. Krokodilon Polis & a village from the Herakleides meris, late 3rd or early 2nd c. BC (211/210 or 194/3 BC [?]). - 9. Inv. 54. Payment in installments. Arsinoite nome (?), 3rd c. BC. - 10. Inv. 61. Payment in installments. Arsinoite nome (?), 1st half of 2nd c. BC (?). - 11. Inv. 31. Petition from prison. Krokodilon Polis, late 3rd c. BC. - 12. Inv. 30. Note concerning a petition. Arsinoite nome (?), late 3rd c. BC. - 13. Inv. 38. Note concerning a petition. Arsinoite nome (?), late 3rd c. BC. - 14. Inv. 9 + 34 verso. Account. Krokodilon Polis (?), 234/3-211 BC. - 15. Inv. 35 recto. Account. Krokodilon Polis, late 3rd or early 2nd c. BC. - 16. Inv. 60. Account. Arsinoite nome (?), late 3rd c. BC. - 17. Inv. 48. Account (?). Arsinoite nome (?), 2nd c. BC (?). - 18. Inv. 37. Hypomnema (?). Arsinoite nome (?), February 195 or 171 BC. - 19. Inv. 43. Beginning of a contract (?). Arsinoite nome (?), late 3rd c. BC (?). - 20. Inv. 53. Draft of a letter. Arsinoite nome (?), late 3rd c. BC (221/20 or 204/3 BC [?]). - 21. Inv. 26. Letter about a gooseherd. Arsinoite nome (?), late 3rd c. BC. - 22. Inv. 45. Letter. Arsinoite nome (?), late 3rd c. BC. - 23. Inv. 46. Name list. Arsinoite nome (?), 2nd c. BC. - 24. Inv. 47. Name list. Arsinoite nome (?), 2nd c. BC. - 25. Inv. 49. Policeman. Arsinoite nome (?), late 3rd or early 2nd c. BC. - 26. Inv. 41. Act prescript. Arsinoite nome (?), late 3rd or early 2nd c. BC. - 27. Inv. 52. Personal description. Arsinoite nome (?), late 3rd c. BC (?). - 28. Inv. 44. Fragment. Arsinoite nome (?), late 3rd c. BC (?). - 29. Inv. 55. Fragment. Arsinoite nome (?), late 3rd c. BC. - 30. Inv. 57. Fragment. Arsinoite nome (?), 2nd c. BC. - 31. Inv. 58. Fragment. Arsinoite nome (?), 2nd c. BC (?). - 32. Inv. 59. Fragment. Arsinoite nome (?), 2nd c. BC.
